column4: mom, dad, sister, brother...
column5: How many people are in your family?

column4: not nice, breaking the rules
column5: If you are naughty then you can't have break.

column4: number one
column5: Please turn to the first page.

column4: a girl in your family
column5: Does your sister have long hair?

column4: a boy in your family
column5: My brother can play the guitar.

column4: done, finished
column5: She completes her homework quickly.

column4: the biggest city in a country
column5: What is the capital of Taiwan?

column4: a person who can help you when you're sick
column5: Do you need to see a doctor?

column4: a dot at the end of a sentence
column5: Don't forget to write a period!

column4: somewhere
column5: Can you tell me about your favorite place?

column4: a period for questions
column5: You need to use a question mark!

column4: an empty place where you can write
column5: Write the answers in the blanks.

column4: every one
column5: Each ant picks up a bit of food.

column4: a country near Japan and China
column5: Have you ever been to Korea?

column4: to sit with someone and ask them questions
column5: Can I interview you for the newspaper?

column4: something wrong
column5: Be careful not to make mistakes.

column4: a kind of food with two pieces of bread
column5: What do you like to put on a sandwich?

column4: to make a loud sound when you bite it or step on it
column5: She can hear the crunchy leaves as she walks.

column4: tasty
column5: What is the most delicious food in the world?

column4: the first meal of the day
column5: What time do you eat breakfast?

column4: a, e, i, o, u, sometimes y
column5: How many vowel sounds are there?

column4: Not a vowel
column5: How many consonants are there?

column4: to see how many there are, 1 2 3 4...
column5: Count to 20 when you wash your hands!

column4: a fruit with a yellow center
column5: Do pineapples grow on trees?

column4: a long bug with no legs
column5: The boys play with worms in the yard.

column4: a big car that is used for working
column5: The truck drives over the rocks.

column4: to do work with numbers, 1+1=2
column5: She really likes studying math in school.

column4: a big car that takes people to other places for money
column5: We can take the bus to the bank.

column4: symbols in English that are not letters or numbers
column5: Don't forget to use punctuation!

column4: a place that people built that you can go inside
column5: How many people live in your building?

column4: an animal that swims in the ocean like a small whale
column5: The two dolphins swim in the sea.

column4: to make sure something doesn't get hurt
column5: Please save me from the monster!

column4: a game that you play on a table
column5: What is your favorite boardgame to play?

column4: a toy that looks like a small person
column5: The kids play with dolls in the tiny house.

column4: a toy that is a wheel on a string
column5: The string on my yo-yo is broken.

column4: a person made out of a computer
column5: Do you think robots can help people?

column4: a piece of paper with a sticky side
column5: She puts stickers on her friend's paper.

column4: more than one
column5: What is the plural of 'child'?

column4: long noodles from Italy
column5: This noodle shop has great spaghetti!

column4: a brown drink that helps you stay awake
column5: If you're tired, you can drink some coffee.

column4: a thing, something you can buy
column5: How many items are you buying today?

column4: to say the letters in a word
column5: How do you spell your name?

column4: not fun
column5: She falls asleep in her boring math class.

column4: to be done working, not doing something anymore
column5: Can I play after I finish writing my homework?

column4: to clean your body with water falling from the wall
column5: He takes a shower every morning at 7:00.

column4: not hard, not crazy, not complicated
column5: She writes a simple sentence in English.

column4: not the same
column5: Is there a different restaurant we can go to?

column4: a game where you hit a ball into a hole
column5: Are you any good at golf?

column4: a time of day that is almost night
column5: What are you doing on Friday evening?

column4: something that you really need to know or do
column5: English is important if you want to travel.

column4: the beginning of the day, before noon
column5: What do you usually do in the morning?

column4: an action word
column5: When do you need to put an 's' on the verb?
